user.description:
To create a Telegram bot, follow these steps:

1. Open Telegram and start a chat with [{botfather_username}]({botfather_url}).
1. Send the command `/newbot`.
1. Follow the instructions to create your bot and get your API token.

data_description.api_key: The API token of your bot.

data_description.proxy_url:
Proxy URL if working behind one, optionally including username and password.
(socks5://username:password@proxy_ip:proxy_port)

data_description.url: Allow to overwrite the external URL from the Home Assistant configuration for different setups.
data_description.trusted_networks:
Telegram server access ACL as list.
Default: 149.154.160.0/20, 91.108.4.0/22

error.no_url_available: URL is required since you have not configured an external URL in Home Assistant

data_description.parse_mode: Default parse mode for messages if not explicit in message data.

data_description.chat_id: ID representing the user or group chat to which messages can be sent.

config_entry_id.name: Config entry ID
config_entry_id.description: The config entry representing the Telegram bot to send the message.

title.name: Title
title.description: Optional title for your notification. Will be composed as '%title\n%message'.

target.name: Target
target.description: An array of pre-authorized chat IDs to send the notification to. If not present, first allowed chat ID is the default.

disable_notification.name: Disable notification
disable_notification.description: Sends the message silently. iOS users and Web users will not receive a notification, Android users will receive a notification with no sound.

disable_web_page_preview.name: Disable web page preview
disable_web_page_preview.description: Disables link previews for links in the message.

timeout.name: Read timeout
timeout.description: Timeout for sending the message in seconds. Will help with timeout errors (poor Internet connection, etc).

keyboard.name: Keyboard
keyboard.description: List of rows of commands, comma-separated, to make a custom keyboard. Empty list clears a previously set keyboard.

inline_keyboard.name: Inline keyboard
inline_keyboard.description: List of rows of commands, comma-separated, to make a custom inline keyboard with buttons with associated callback data.

reply_to_message_id.name: Reply to message ID
reply_to_message_id.description: Mark the message as a reply to a previous message.

message_thread_id.name: Message thread ID
message_thread_id.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only.

config_entry_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_message::fields::config_entry_id::name%]
config_entry_id.description: The config entry representing the Telegram bot to send the chat action.

target.name: Target
target.description: An array of pre-authorized chat IDs to send the chat action to. If not present, first allowed chat ID is the default.

config_entry_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_message::fields::config_entry_id::name%]
config_entry_id.description: The config entry representing the Telegram bot to send the photo.

username.name: [%key:common::config_flow::data::username%]
username.description: Username for a URL that requires 'Basic' or 'Digest' authentication.

password.name: [%key:common::config_flow::data::password%]
password.description: Password (or bearer token) for a URL that requires authentication.

authentication.name: Authentication method
authentication.description: Define which authentication method to use. Set to 'Basic' for HTTP basic authentication, 'Digest' for HTTP digest authentication, or 'Bearer token' for OAuth 2.0 bearer token authentication.

target.name: Target
target.description: An array of pre-authorized chat IDs to send the document to. If not present, first allowed chat ID is the default.

verify_ssl.name: Verify SSL
verify_ssl.description: Enable or disable SSL certificate verification. Disable if you're downloading the file from a URL and you don't want to validate the SSL certificate of the server.

timeout.name: Read timeout
timeout.description: Timeout for sending the photo in seconds.

keyboard.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_message::fields::keyboard::name%]
keyboard.description: List of rows of commands, comma-separated, to make a custom keyboard.

config_entry_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_message::fields::config_entry_id::name%]
config_entry_id.description: The config entry representing the Telegram bot to send the sticker.

url.name: [%key:common::config_flow::data::url%]
url.description: Remote path to a static .webp or animated .tgs sticker.

file.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_photo::fields::file::name%]
file.description: Local path to a static .webp or animated .tgs sticker.

sticker_id.name: Sticker ID
sticker_id.description: ID of a sticker that exists on telegram servers.

timeout.name: Read timeout
timeout.description: Timeout for sending the sticker in seconds.

config_entry_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_message::fields::config_entry_id::name%]
config_entry_id.description: The config entry representing the Telegram bot to send the animation.

url.name: [%key:common::config_flow::data::url%]
url.description: Remote path to a GIF or H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound.

file.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_photo::fields::file::name%]
file.description: Local path to a GIF or H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound.

config_entry_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_message::fields::config_entry_id::name%]
config_entry_id.description: The config entry representing the Telegram bot to send the video.

timeout.name: Read timeout
timeout.description: Timeout for sending the video in seconds.

config_entry_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_message::fields::config_entry_id::name%]
config_entry_id.description: The config entry representing the Telegram bot to send the voice message.

url.name: [%key:common::config_flow::data::url%]
url.description: Remote path to a voice message.

file.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_photo::fields::file::name%]
file.description: Local path to a voice message.

caption.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_photo::fields::caption::name%]
caption.description: The title of the voice message.

timeout.name: Read timeout
timeout.description: Timeout for sending the voice in seconds.

config_entry_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_message::fields::config_entry_id::name%]
config_entry_id.description: The config entry representing the Telegram bot to send the document.

timeout.name: Read timeout
timeout.description: Timeout for sending the document in seconds.

config_entry_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_message::fields::config_entry_id::name%]
config_entry_id.description: The config entry representing the Telegram bot to send the location.

target.name: Target
target.description: An array of pre-authorized chat IDs to send the location to. If not present, first allowed chat ID is the default.

config_entry_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_message::fields::config_entry_id::name%]
config_entry_id.description: The config entry representing the Telegram bot to send the poll.

options.name: Options
options.description: List of answer options, 2-10 strings 1-100 characters each.

is_anonymous.name: Is anonymous
is_anonymous.description: If the poll needs to be anonymous. This is the default.

allows_multiple_answers.name: Allow multiple answers
allows_multiple_answers.description: If the poll allows multiple answers.

open_period.name: Open period
open_period.description: Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation, 5-600.

timeout.name: Read timeout
timeout.description: Timeout for sending the poll in seconds.

config_entry_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_message::fields::config_entry_id::name%]
config_entry_id.description: The config entry representing the Telegram bot to edit the message.

message_id.name: Message ID
message_id.description: ID of the message to edit.

chat_id.name: Chat ID
chat_id.description: ID of the chat where to edit the message.

edit_message_media.name: Edit message media
edit_message_media.description: Edits the media content of a previously sent message.

config_entry_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_message::fields::config_entry_id::name%]
config_entry_id.description: The config entry representing the Telegram bot to edit the message media.

timeout.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_photo::fields::timeout::name%]
timeout.description: Timeout for sending the media in seconds.

edit_caption.name: Edit caption
edit_caption.description: Edits the caption of a previously sent message.

config_entry_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_message::fields::config_entry_id::name%]
config_entry_id.description: The config entry representing the Telegram bot to edit the caption.

chat_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::edit_message::fields::chat_id::name%]
chat_id.description: ID of the chat where to edit the caption.

edit_replymarkup.name: Edit reply markup
edit_replymarkup.description: Edits the inline keyboard of a previously sent message.

config_entry_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_message::fields::config_entry_id::name%]
config_entry_id.description: The config entry representing the Telegram bot to edit the reply markup.

chat_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::edit_message::fields::chat_id::name%]
chat_id.description: ID of the chat where to edit the reply markup.

answer_callback_query.name: Answer callback query
answer_callback_query.description: Responds to a callback query originated by clicking on an online keyboard button. The answer will be displayed to the user as a notification at the top of the chat screen or as an alert.

config_entry_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_message::fields::config_entry_id::name%]
config_entry_id.description: The config entry representing the Telegram bot to answer the callback query.

message.name: Message
message.description: Unformatted text message body of the notification.

callback_query_id.name: Callback query ID
callback_query_id.description: Unique ID of the callback response.

timeout.name: Read timeout
timeout.description: Timeout for sending the answer in seconds.

config_entry_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_message::fields::config_entry_id::name%]
config_entry_id.description: The config entry representing the Telegram bot to delete the message.

message_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::edit_message::fields::message_id::name%]
message_id.description: ID of the message to delete.

chat_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::edit_message::fields::chat_id::name%]
chat_id.description: ID of the chat where to delete the message.

leave_chat.name: Leave chat
leave_chat.description: Removes the bot from the chat.

config_entry_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_message::fields::config_entry_id::name%]
config_entry_id.description: The config entry representing the Telegram bot to leave the chat.

chat_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::edit_message::fields::chat_id::name%]
chat_id.description: Chat ID of the group from which the bot should be removed.

set_message_reaction.name: Set message reaction
set_message_reaction.description: Sets the bot's reaction for a given message.

config_entry_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::send_message::fields::config_entry_id::name%]
config_entry_id.description: The config entry representing the Telegram bot to set the message reaction.

message_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::edit_message::fields::message_id::name%]
message_id.description: ID of the message to react to.

chat_id.name: [%key:component::telegram_bot::services::edit_message::fields::chat_id::name%]
chat_id.description: ID of the chat containing the message.

is_big.name: Large animation
is_big.description: Whether the reaction animation should be large.

multiple_config_entry.message: Multiple config entries found. Please specify the Telegram bot to use in the Config entry ID field.

missing_config_entry.message: No config entries found or setup failed. Please set up the Telegram Bot first.

missing_allowed_chat_ids.message: No allowed chat IDs found. Please add allowed chat IDs for {bot_name}.

invalid_chat_ids.message: Invalid chat IDs: {chat_ids}. Please configure the chat IDs for {bot_name}.

invalid_inline_keyboard.message: Invalid value for inline keyboard. Only strings or lists are accepted.

failed_chat_ids.message: Failed targets: {chat_ids}. Please verify that the chat IDs for {bot_name} have been configured.

allowlist_external_dirs_error.message: File path has not been configured in allowlist_external_dirs.

deprecated_yaml.title: The {integration_title} YAML configuration is being removed
deprecated_yaml.description:
Configuring {integration_title} using YAML is being removed.

Your existing YAML configuration has been imported into the UI automatically.

Remove the `{domain}` configuration from your configuration.yaml file and restart Home Assistant to fix this issue.

deprecated_yaml_import_issue_has_more_pl.title: The {integration_title} YAML configuration is being removed
deprecated_yaml_import_issue_has_more_pl.description:
Configuring {integration_title} using YAML is being removed.

The last entry of your existing YAML configuration ({telegram_bot}) has been imported into the UI automatically.

Remove the `{domain}` configuration from your configuration.yaml file and restart Home Assistant to fix this issue. The other Telegram bots will need to be configured manually in the UI.

deprecated_yaml_import_issue_error.title: YAML import failed due to invalid {error_field}
deprecated_yaml_import_issue_error.description:
Configuring {integration_title} using YAML is being removed but there was an error while importing your existing configuration ({telegram_bot}): {error_message}.
Setup will not proceed.

Verify that your {telegram_bot} is operating correctly and restart Home Assistant to attempt the import again.

Alternatively, you may remove the `{domain}` configuration from your configuration.yaml entirely, restart Home Assistant, and add the {integration_title} integration manually.
